text:
I know this might be a bad Idea. However, I'm curious if I could put the UI Extension Project inside a different github repo?
We have a repository where we do a middleware to connect HubSpot with third party system. We also needed custom UI Extension with hs project.
At the moment, we have two separate github repo. But our PM was curious if we could put it in one github repo?
<@U05ENUJF7B5> could you take a look at this when you have a chance?
try updating your CLI, this is possibly because you're running in dev mode with an outdated CLI
`npm install -g @HubSpot/cli@latest`

hello, I am trying to follow the steps in the "Hello world" integration <https://developers.HubSpot.com/blog/hello-world-creating-your-first-react-graphql-custom-card-for-HubSpots-crm>
but I'm stuck at exactly the same place as this post: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/hs-project-upload-is-failing-with-documentation-examples-data/td-p/867979>
Do you have any idea why this is happening, as the error is of no help to me :slightly_frowning_face: ?
Thank you
Yes, it's possible you're using an older version of either the dev server or the components. Try doing an `npm update`. The latest version of `@HubSpot/ui-extensions` is `0.8.1`
try running `npm install` in the src/app/extensions folder
Thanks, I'm running the latest of both, the CLI and the `ui-extensions`
It also doesn't work when uploaded (i.e. not connected to local dev)

thank you for the reply, but unfortunatelly that didn't change anything, I have exactly the same error
":heavy_multiplication_x: Failed to upload Fulfillment Card project files to DemoSynolia (XXXXXXX)
[ERROR] The post in account XXXXXXXwas bad. The JSON in the file '/app/extensions/fulfillment-card.json' doesn't match the associated scheme. Correct and/or add values to all relevant fields and try again.
- $.data.fetch: is missing but it is required"
Do you want to share your files?
dont know how to do that, but yes
it is the standard files from "hello world"
and a "Demo" HubSpot instance
Ah I found it! I had the `location` of the crm-card set to `crm.record.sidebar` to make a sidebar extension. When changing it to `crm.record.tab`it works.

So it seems like the `CrmAssociationTable` is not supported for sidebar extensions?
Is this intentional or is this a bug?
Either way, would be helpful to document this or improve the error message
<@U03FJQPSC0Y>

Ahh, nice find! This is perhaps a chance for us to show some better error messaging since the sidebar does not currently support the CRM components. This is not a bug but an intentional decision for the time being.
I updated it with your values
still the same error :disappointed:

Yes. It's not a big problem, because it's easy enough to load the data from a serverless func and then display in a table. But definitely, some hint in the error message would be helpful. It wasn't obvious to me that sidebar vs record tab have different components
<@U03FJQPSC0Y> +1 for this request. Ideally the `navigator.clipboard` API could be made available
interesting, and you do have a file named card-frontend.jsx?
Is it possible to trigger the display of an IFrame from an extension? Either as a modal popup or inline?
yes modal is the only option currently
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/create-ui-extensions#open-an-iframe-in-a-modal>
Perfect, thanks! I overlooked that
of course
:wave: Hi, we don’t currently support .cjs file extensions for app functions so that cause the builds to fail.
yes
